name: master-ball
effects: Catches a wild Pokémon every time.

name: ultra-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 2×.

name: great-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 1.5×.

name: poke-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.

name: safari-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon in the Great Marsh or Safari Zone.  Success rate is 1.5×.

name: net-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3× for water and bug Pokémon.

name: dive-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate is 3.5× when underwater, fishing, or surfing.

name: nest-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3.9× for level 1 Pokémon, and drops steadily to 1× at level 30.

name: repeat-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3× for previously-caught Pokémon.

name: timer-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate increases by 0.1× (Gen V: 0.3×) every turn, to a max of 4×.

name: luxury-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Caught Pokémon start with 200 happiness.

name: premier-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.

name: dusk-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3.5× at night and in caves.

name: heal-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Caught Pokémon are immediately healed.

name: quick-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate is 4× (Gen V: 5×), but only on the first turn.

name: cherish-ball
effects: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.

name: potion
effects: Restores 20 HP.

name: antidote
effects: Cures poison.

name: burn-heal
effects: Cures a burn.

name: ice-heal
effects: Cures freezing.

name: awakening
effects: Cures sleep.

name: paralyze-heal
effects: Cures paralysis.

name: full-restore
effects: Restores HP to full and cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: max-potion
effects: Restores HP to full.

name: hyper-potion
effects: Restores 200 HP.

name: super-potion
effects: Restores 50 HP.

name: full-heal
effects: Cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: revive
effects: Revives with half HP.

name: max-revive
effects: Revives with full HP.

name: fresh-water
effects: Restores 50 HP.

name: soda-pop
effects: Restores 60 HP.

name: lemonade
effects: Restores 80 HP.

name: moomoo-milk
effects: Restores 100 HP.

name: energy-powder
effects: Restores 50 HP, but lowers happiness.

name: energy-root
effects: Restores 200 HP, but lowers happiness.

name: heal-powder
effects: Cures any status ailment, but lowers happiness.

name: revival-herb
effects: Revives with full HP, but lowers happiness.

name: ether
effects: Restores 10 PP for one move.

name: max-ether
effects: Restores PP to full for one move.

name: elixir
effects: Restores 10 PP for each move.

name: max-elixir
effects: Restores PP to full for each move.

name: lava-cookie
effects: Cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: berry-juice
effects: Restores 20 HP.

name: sacred-ash
effects: Revives all fainted Pokémon with full HP.

name: hp-up
effects: Raises HP effort and happiness.

name: protein
effects: Raises Attack effort and happiness.

name: iron
effects: Raises Defense effort and happiness.

name: carbos
effects: Raises Speed effort and happiness.

name: calcium
effects: Raises Special Attack effort and happiness.

name: rare-candy
effects: Causes a level-up and raises happiness.

name: pp-up
effects: Raises a move's max PP by 20%.

name: zinc
effects: Raises Special Defense and happiness.

name: pp-max
effects: Raises a move's max PP by 60%.

name: old-gateau
effects: Cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: guard-spec
effects: Prevents stat changes in battle for five turns in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: dire-hit
effects: Increases the chance of a critical hit in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: x-attack
effects: Raises Attack by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: x-defense
effects: Raises Defense by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: x-speed
effects: Raises Speed by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: x-accuracy
effects: Raises accuracy by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: x-sp-atk
effects: Raises Special Attack by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: x-sp-def
effects: Raises Special Defense by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: poke-doll
effects: Ends a wild battle.

name: fluffy-tail
effects: Ends a wild battle.

name: blue-flute
effects: Cures sleep.

name: yellow-flute
effects: Cures confusion.

name: red-flute
effects: Cures attraction.

name: black-flute
effects: Halves the wild Pokémon encounter rate.

name: white-flute
effects: Doubles the wild Pokémon encounter rate.

name: shoal-salt
effects: No effect. Gen III: Trade four and four Shoal Shells for a Shell Bell.

name: shoal-shell
effects: No effect. Gen III: Trade four and four Shoal Salts for a Shell Bell.

name: red-shard
effects: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.

name: blue-shard
effects: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.

name: yellow-shard
effects: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.

name: green-shard
effects: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.

name: super-repel
effects: For 200 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.

name: max-repel
effects: For 250 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.

name: escape-rope
effects: Transports user to the outside entrance of a cave.

name: repel
effects: For 100 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.

name: sun-stone
effects: Evolves a Cottonee into Whimsicott, a Gloom into Bellossom, a Petilil into Lilligant, or a Sunkern into Sunflora.

name: moon-stone
effects: Evolves a Clefairy into Clefable, a Jigglypuff into Wigglytuff, a Munna into Musharna, a Nidorina into Nidoqueen, a Nidorino into Nidoking, or a Skitty into Delcatty.

name: fire-stone
effects: Evolves an Eevee into Flareon, a Growlithe into Arcanine, a Pansear into Simisear, or a Vulpix into Ninetales.

name: thunder-stone
effects: Evolves an Eelektrik into Eelektross, an Eevee into Jolteon, or a Pikachu into Raichu.

name: water-stone
effects: Evolves an Eevee into Vaporeon, a Lombre into Ludicolo, a Panpour into Simipour, a Poliwhirl into Poliwrath, a Shellder into Cloyster, or a Staryu into Starmie.

name: leaf-stone
effects: Evolves an Exeggcute into Exeggutor, a Gloom into Vileplume, a Nuzleaf into Shiftry, a Pansage into Simisage, or a Weepinbell into Victreebel.

name: tiny-mushroom
effects: Fire Red and Leaf Green: Trade two for prior Level-up moves. Sell for 250 Pokédollars, or to Hungry Maid for 500 Pokédollars.

name: big-mushroom
effects: Fire Red and Leaf Green: Trade for prior Level-up moves. Sell for 2500 Pokédollars, or to Hungry Maid for 5000 Pokédollars.

name: pearl
effects: Sell for 700 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 1400 Pokédollars.

name: big-pearl
effects: Sell for 3750 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 7500 Pokédollars.

name: stardust
effects: Sell for 1000 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 2000 Pokédollars.

name: star-piece
effects: Platinum: Trade for one of each color Shard. Black and White: Trade for PP Up. Sell for 4900 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 9800 Pokédollars.

name: nugget
effects: Sell for 5000 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 10000 Pokédollars.

name: heart-scale
effects: No effect. Can be traded for prior Level-up moves.

name: growth-mulch
effects: Growing time of berries is reduced, but the soil dries out faster.

name: damp-mulch
effects: Growing time of berries is increased, but the soil dries out slower.

name: stable-mulch
effects: Berries stay on the plant for longer than their usual time.

name: gooey-mulch
effects: Berries regrow from dead plants an increased number of times.

name: root-fossil
effects: Can be revived into a Lileep.
